title: Quiz 2: FQE 2019
description: Full exam paper from 2019 FQE covering MCQs, Short Essay Questions, and a Long Essay Question on PPROM.

questions.question: Which of the following is an ovarian germ cell tumour?
questions.explanation: Dysgerminoma is the most common malignant germ cell tumor of the ovary. While Dermoid cyst is also a germ cell tumor (benign), Dysgerminoma is the classic malignant example often tested.
questions.hint: It is the female equivalent of a seminoma in males.

questions.question: Which of the following is an absolute contra-indication to the IUCD use?

options.text: A history of pelvic inflammatory disease
Previous pregnancy with an IUCD four years ago

questions.explanation: Unexplained abnormal genital bleeding is an absolute contraindication (WHO MEC Category 4) as it may mask underlying pathology like cancer.
questions.hint: Think about a symptom that could indicate cancer.

questions.question: Regarding multiple pregnancy:

options.text: Has a lower risk for morbidity compared to singleton
Twins occur with an incidence of 1:6400 births globally
Dichorionic placentation is observed in both monozygotic and dizygotic twins

questions.explanation: All dizygotic twins are dichorionic. Monozygotic twins that split early (Days 0-3) also develop dichorionic placentation.
questions.hint: Consider when the splitting of the zygote occurs.

questions.question: Regarding cardiac disease in pregnancy:

options.text: Class III is admitted in the hospital for the duration of the pregnancy from 28 weeks
Anticoagulants should be discontinued in the first trimester for patients with valve replacement

questions.explanation: NYHA Class III patients have marked limitation of activity and are at high risk of decompensation as hemodynamic burden peaks (28-32 weeks), requiring hospitalization.
questions.hint: When does cardiac output peak in pregnancy?

questions.question: Endometriosis is:

options.text: A condition that causes constant abdominal pains
A condition that causes cyclical abdominal pains
A common cause of tubal infertility

questions.explanation: The hallmark symptom is secondary dysmenorrhea (cyclical pain corresponding to menstruation) due to bleeding of ectopic endometrial tissue.
questions.hint: Does the pain pattern relate to the menstrual cycle?

questions.question: The following are associated with endometrial carcinoma EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Unopposed estrogen is the risk factor. Progesterones are protective against endometrial hyperplasia and cancer.
questions.hint: Which hormone protects the endometrium?

questions.question: Warfarin during pregnancy:

options.text: Exerts an anticoagulant effect on the breast fed infant

questions.explanation: Fetal Warfarin Syndrome (chondrodysplasia punctata) occurs if used in the 1st trimester, affecting bone/cartilage development.
questions.hint: Think about teratogenic effects on the skeleton.

questions.question: Which of the following factors is NOT responsible for the development of pregnancy induced insulin resistance?

options.text: Increased placental secretion of growth hormone
Decreased secretion of human chorionic somatostatin

questions.explanation: The primary diabetogenic hormones are hPL, Progesterone, Cortisol, and Growth Hormone. Somatostatin changes are not a primary driver.
questions.hint: Focus on the major placental hormones.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT important in the diagnosis of pelvic abscess?

options.text: Painful defecation and lower back pain

questions.explanation: VDRL screens for Syphilis, which causes ulcers/rashes, not acute pelvic abscesses.
questions.hint: Which test is for a sexually transmitted infection that doesn't typically cause abscesses?

questions.question: Concerning antenatal blood tests:

options.text: Syphilis test is no longer necessary
HIV test requires the consent of the spouse
Indirect coombs test is not necessary in a rhesus negative mother
Hepatitis B surface antigen test is recommended

questions.explanation: HBsAg screening is standard to prevent vertical transmission. Indirect Coombs IS necessary for Rh-negative mothers.
questions.hint: Think about viral infections transmitted from mother to child.

questions.question: Which of the following is the earliest fetal sign of uterine rupture in women undergoing a trial of labour?
questions.explanation: Fetal bradycardia/decelerations are the most consistent early sign of uterine rupture due to placental compromise.
questions.hint: What is the most sensitive indicator of fetal wellbeing?

questions.question: Which of the following is a feature of missed abortion?

options.text: Bright red heavy per vaginal bleeding

questions.explanation: A missed abortion is characterized by retention of non-viable products. Ultrasound typically shows a deformed/irregular sac or absence of cardiac activity.
questions.hint: Think about what an ultrasound would show for a non-viable pregnancy.

questions.question: The following is true about placenta Previa:

options.text: May present with no per vaginal bleeding
Type II covers the internal os

questions.explanation: It can be an incidental finding on ultrasound in an asymptomatic patient. Coagulopathy and Couvelaire uterus are associated with Abruptio Placenta.
questions.hint: Can placenta previa be diagnosed before symptoms appear?

questions.question: Which of the following statements is NOT true?

options.text: HPV has been detected in over 90% of cancer of the cervix
Chlamydia are able to grow in a cell free media
Chlamydia salpingitis is associated with Fitz-Hugh Curtis syndrome

questions.explanation: Chlamydia is an obligate intracellular pathogen and cannot grow in cell-free media.
questions.hint: Does Chlamydia need a host cell to replicate?

questions.question: As regards MTCT of HIV:

options.text: MTCT is nearly 60% for a HIV positive mother
When the maternal viral load is undetectable MTCT does not occur
Mixed infant feeding does have no effect on HIV transmission rate
Proper interventions may reduce the transmission(MTCT) rate to 2%

questions.explanation: With comprehensive PMTCT (ART, safe delivery, prophylaxis), transmission rates can be reduced to <2%.
questions.hint: How effective is modern PMTCT?

questions.question: In female surgical sterilization:

options.text: Tubal ligation is best done during the luteal phase
Non- absorbable suture material is ideal in tubal ligation
Histology of the fallopian segment is recommended
Tubal ligation is best done at the fimbrial part

questions.explanation: Histology confirms that the structure ligated/excised was indeed the fallopian tube (medicolegal proof).
questions.hint: How do you prove legally that the sterilization was performed correctly?

questions.question: Induction of ovulation with clomiphene citrate:

options.text: Is indicated in patients with premature ovarian failure
Is indicated in patients with Asherman syndrome

questions.explanation: It works by blocking estrogen feedback, increasing FSH, indicated for WHO Group II (PCOS).
questions.hint: Does it work if there are no follicles left (ovarian failure)?

questions.question: The stage of the gestational development at which endometrial implantation occurs is:
questions.explanation: Implantation occurs 6-7 days post-fertilization at the blastocyst stage.
questions.hint: What is the hollow ball of cells called?

questions.question: Which of the following statements about amniotic fluid is correct?

options.text: The volume has no prognostic value in pregnancy
An increase in volume is usually associated with fetal chromosomal abnormalities
A decrease in volume is associated with fetal chromosomal abnormalities
Amniotic fluid is solely from the amnion at 36 weeks

questions.explanation: Polyhydramnios is associated with anomalies (e.g., GI obstruction) and chromosomal defects.
questions.hint: Think about conditions causing polyhydramnios.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true of maternal physiological changes during pregnancy?

options.text: Cardiac output increases by 20% in the first trimester
Respiratory rate increases secondary to the effects of estradiol
There is no change in the stroke volume

questions.explanation: Significant increase in RPF and GFR occurs early in pregnancy.
questions.hint: Think about the renal system adaptation.

questions.question: Hyperemesis gravidarum is commonly encountered in pregnancy. Which of the following is NOT an associated finding?
questions.explanation: Dehydration causes hemoconcentration (increase in hematocrit), not reduction.
questions.hint: What happens to blood concentration when you lose fluid?

questions.question: Serious complications of ovarian tumors during pregnancy include all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Torsion, Rupture, and Malignancy are intrinsic complications of the tumor. Premature labor is an obstetric consequence.
questions.hint: Focus on the tumor itself.

questions.question: Ruptured ectopic pregnancy is associated with:

options.text: Decreased pelvic blood flow on Doppler study

questions.explanation: Blood in the peritoneal cavity loses its clotting factors (defibrination).
questions.hint: Why does culdocentesis yield non-clotting blood?

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is NOT true regarding focused antenatal care(FANC)?

options.text: Forth visit can be at 36 weeks

questions.explanation: 4 visits was the MINIMUM in the old FANC model. 'Only four' implies a restriction, which is false.
questions.hint: Is there a limit on the number of visits?

questions.question: Concerning prolonged latent phase of labour:

options.text: Fetal distress is a likely outcome
May be associated with urinary tract infection
Management may involve ARM together with prostaglandins

questions.explanation: UTI is a common cause of 'false labor' or prolonged latent phase contractions.
questions.hint: What infection can trigger uterine activity?

questions.question: Type 1 endometrial carcinoma is associated with:
questions.explanation: Type 1 (Endometrioid) is estrogen-dependent.
questions.hint: What drives endometrial proliferation?

questions.question: Which one of the following is a cause of secondary amenorrhea?
questions.explanation: PCOS is the most common cause of secondary amenorrhea.
questions.hint: Think of the most common endocrine disorder in women.

questions.question: The following statement is correct concerning the puerperium:

options.text: Regeneration of placental site in the endometrium is complete by 4th week
Endocervical glandular hyperplasia may persist up to 12 weeks
Proteinuria only occurs if there is hypertensive disease of pregnancy

questions.explanation: Regeneration of the placental site is a key part of involution.
questions.hint: How long does it take for the uterus to return to normal?

questions.question: Regarding breast feeding, which of the following statement is NOT correct?

options.text: Increases the risk of breast cancer developing in the mother
Reduces the risk of endometrial cancer development in the mother
Reduces the risk of developing breast cancer in the mother
Reduces the risk of GIT infections in the baby

questions.explanation: Breastfeeding REDUCES the risk of breast cancer.
questions.hint: Does breastfeeding protect or harm the mother?

questions.question: Which of the following is the largest fetal skull diameter?
questions.explanation: Mento-vertical measures approx 13.5 cm (Brow presentation).
questions.hint: Which presentation causes the largest diameter to present?

questions.question: Regarding cardiac disease in pregnancy:

options.text: The commonest cause in Kenya is congenital heart disease
Aortic regurgitation is the commonest cardiac lesion encountered
Vacuum assisted delivery should be planned for all vaginal deliveries

questions.explanation: Assisted delivery shortens the second stage to prevent maternal pushing/Valsalva.
questions.hint: How can we reduce cardiac workload during delivery?

questions.question: The most common type of breech presentation is:
questions.explanation: Frank breech (extended legs) accounts for 65-70%.
questions.hint: Legs are up by the ears.

questions.question: Vacuum extraction in labour can be done in the following conditions:

options.text: Delivery of the after coming head in breech presentation

questions.explanation: Severe anaemia is an indication to shorten the second stage.
questions.hint: When should maternal effort be minimized?

questions.question: Deep transverse arrest is commonest in:
questions.explanation: Android pelvis (heart-shaped) has convergent sidewalls causing arrest.
questions.hint: Which pelvis type is male-like?

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true about transverse lie?

options.text: Fetal heart sounds are best heard above the level of the umbilicus
Fundus is at lower level than the expected gestational age
Head is palpable in one or the other iliac fossa

questions.explanation: FHS is best heard below the umbilicus in midline.
questions.hint: Where is the back of the fetus usually located?

questions.question: As regards the induction of labour, which of the following statement is true?

options.text: Pre-induction Bishop scoring can predict the success of induction
In Bishop scoring, total score is 10

questions.explanation: High Bishop score (>6) predicts success.
questions.hint: What assesses cervical favorability?

questions.question: Which of the following statement is true concerning vacuum delivery?

options.text: Usually, an episiotomy is not required
Is normally avoided in patients with cardiac disease during second stage
Can be used safely from 8cm cervical dilatation

questions.explanation: Cephalohematoma is a known complication due to suction.
questions.hint: What injury happens to the scalp?

questions.question: The commonest complication of Hydatidiform Mole is?
questions.explanation: Bleeding occurs in >90% of cases.
questions.hint: What is the most common presenting symptom?

questions.question: Concerning anaemia in pregnancy:

options.text: Iron in haemoglobin accounts for 55% of the total iron
Ferritin has more iron than hemosiderrin

questions.explanation: Physiological anaemia due to plasma volume expansion is common.
questions.hint: Think about fluid changes in pregnancy.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The ureter lies medial to the uterine artery at the level of the cervix
The pouch of Douglas lies between the bladder and the uterus
The ovary is attached to the lateral pelvic side walls
The mucosa of the fallopian tube is lined by ciliated cells

questions.explanation: Cilia aid in ovum transport.
questions.hint: How does the egg move?

questions.question: Focused antenatal care (FANC) is one of the pillars of safe motherhood. Outline 5 elements of FANC: (Select all that apply)

options.text: Early detection and treatment of complications

questions.explanation: FANC components: Early detection, Prevention, BP/CR, Health promotion, Managing existing conditions.
questions.hint: Think about the main goals of ANC.

questions.question: Active management of third stage of labour (AMSTL) lowers the risk of post-partum haemorrhage. Order the steps of AMSTL:
questions.explanation: 1. Rule out twin. 2. Give Oxytocin. 3. CCT. 4. Massage.
questions.hint: What must you do before giving oxytocin?

questions.question: Regarding abortion, identify the causes of recurrent abortion: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Recurrent causes: Cervical incompetence, Genetic, Uterine anomalies, Endocrine, APLS.
questions.hint: Think of chronic or anatomical issues.

questions.question: Enumerate clients who should NOT use Depoprovera according to medical eligibility criteria: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: MEC 3/4 conditions: Pregnancy, Breast cancer, Severe liver disease, Unexplained bleeding.
questions.hint: Think about conditions worsened by hormones.

questions.question: Outline risk factors for Deep Venous Thrombosis (DVT) in pregnancy: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Virchow's triad factors: Stasis, Hypercoagulability, Injury (C-section).
questions.hint: Think Virchow's triad.

questions.question: Outline investigations for female infertility: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: HSG (tubes), US (anatomy), Progesterone (ovulation), Hormones (ovarian reserve). Semen analysis is for the male.
questions.hint: Focus on female tests.

questions.question: Match the hypertensive disease of pregnancy with its definition:
questions.explanation: Definitions based on onset time and presence of proteinuria/seizures.
questions.hint: Look at the timing and symptoms.

questions.question: List degenerative changes that can occur in uterine fibroids: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Red (pregnancy), Hyaline (common), Cystic, Calcification (post-menopausal).
questions.hint: Changes due to blood supply issues.

questions.question: Mrs. Mary K, 30 years old, at 32 weeks gestation presents with leakage of clear fluid and mild backache. What is the likely diagnosis?

richContent.content: Clinical Scenario: Mrs. Mary K, 30 years old, para 2+0 gravida 3 at 32 weeks’ gestation presents with a one-day history of leakage of clear fluid from her vagina and mild lower backache after heavy chores. She perceives adequate fetal movements.

questions.explanation: Rupture of membranes before 37 weeks without established labor contractions constitutes PPROM.
questions.hint: Fluid leak before term.

questions.question: For the patient in the previous scenario (Mrs. Mary K), select the appropriate management steps: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Management involves: Admission, SSE (avoid digital exam to prevent infection), Steroids for lung maturity, Antibiotics to prolong latency. Delivery is usually delayed until 34 weeks unless infection occurs.
questions.hint: Conservative management vs immediate delivery.
